comments.author: patagonia1

comments.text:
Bear in mind that whilst emotionally the design is romantic & 
other-worldly, practically, it is a disaster. The bark left on the 
timberwork allowed insect damage, & there's no way that mice could be 
prevented from destroying the water-impermeable layer in the roof. I'd 
guess that's why he no longer lives there.﻿

I'm asking about problèmes this kind of house would have to face, such

dream becoming true :-)﻿

comments.text:
The straw insulates the house. There is a waterproof membrane over it and a 
layer of earth on top (more insulation). The straw won't rot as it does not 
get wet.
